document.docAuthor: Yang, Ni, Zhang, Runzhi & Ren, Li
document.docTitle: Xenysmoderodes flos Yang, Zhang & Ren, 2013, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Xenysmoderodes from China (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Ceutorhynchinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Xenysmoderodes from China (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Ceutorhynchinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Integument . Black in general appearance, irregularly covered with dirty-yellow scales or lacking scales. Eyes dark grey. Antennae, tibiae, and tarsi yellowish-brown. Apical margin of pronotum and inner and distal margins of elytra dark-red.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11–14 .
Xenysmoderodes flos
sp. nov.
male holotype. 11, dorsal habitus; 12, lateral habitus; 13, dorsal view of prothorax; 14, lateral view of prothorax. Scales are 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 15–18 .
Xenysmoderodes flos
sp. nov.
15–16, male holotype; 15, ventrites to; 16, pygidium; 17–18, female paratype; 17, ventrites to; 18, pygidium. Scales are 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pronotum ( Figs 13, 14 ) 1.57–1.71 × as wide as long, widest at base, its base 1.28–1.52 × as wide as apex, constricted subapically, subparallel-sided in apical 1 / 5 ; moderately punctured on subapical, subbasal, and lateral surfaces; reticulate carinae on dorsal and lateral surfaces, lacking scales; acute at middle of anterior margin; pronotal carina complete; pronotal spine slender, acutely projected into basal 1 / 3 of elytra; apical margin of pronotum slightly raised; lateral and dorsal surfaces rather strongly convex, each side of pronotal carina with one longitudinal carina curved from 1 / 3 of apical margin to baso-lateral margin.

Legs . Femora clavate, without prominent tooth; metafemora slightly stouter than pro- and mesofemora. Tibiae rod-like, pro- and metatibiae simple at apex, mesotibiae mucronate at inner apex. Procoxae separated by a distance as long as its diameter, length of profemora to protibiae= 1.3 : 1 ; length of mesofemora to mesotibiae= 1.5 : 1 ; length of metafemora to metatibiae= 1.3 : 1 . Tarsi with tarsomere I frustum-like, II oval, III bifid, V twice as long as III; claws obviously appendiculate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–26 .
Xenysmoderodes flos
sp. nov.
19–22, male holotype; 19, aedeagus, dorsal view; 20, aedeagus, lateral view; 21, sternite IX; 22, tegmen; 23–26, female paratype; 23, tergite VIII; 24, sternite VIII; 25, spermatheca; 26, coxite and stylus. Scales are 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 27–28 .
Xenysmoderodes concavus
sp. nov.
, 27, male holotype, dorsal view of rostrum, frons without carina;
Xenysmoderodes flos
sp. nov.
, 28, male holotype, dorsal view of rostrum, frons with carina. Scales are 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Other characters in the female are the same as in the male.

Type material.
Holotype male, China , Guizhou, Zunyi, Lvyang, nature preservation zone of Kuankuoshui, Xiangguangshan country,
28 ° 14 'N
,
107 ° 12 'E
,
4 . VI. 2010
, Wang Zhiliang [IOZ(E) 1803087 ]. Paratypes .
1 male
, China , Zhejiang, Mountain Tianmu, 1050 m ,
30 ° 20 'N
,
119 ° 27 'E
,
31 . VII. 1998
, Yu Zhiyong [IOZ(E) 896962 ];
1 female
, [IOZ(E) 1803082 ], other data as same as the holotype .
Etymology. The species is named from the Latin “ flos ” after its distinct, dense patch of setae in the middle of ventrite V in males; it looks like a flower in full bloom.
